title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sematicweboholic - (00:02): CalebJamesDeLisl, (just being curious) hey i don't see any user - groups related tables in database.. I guess they're stored in somewhere  
sdumitriu - (00:03): sematicweboholic: Users and groups are regular XWiki Objects  
sematicweboholic - (00:06): aah!!  
sematicweboholic - (00:09): Classname field as XWiki.XWikiUsers (neat!)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): (I was eating.) Yes, rights are also objects.  
bblfish left at 00:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 00:30  
sematicweboholic left at 00:36 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:37): I can't find $msg.get('Blog.BlogClass\_title') where/how is that key used?  
anamarias left at 00:39 (Quit: anamarias  
sdumitriu - (00:50): CalebJamesDeLisl: I think that appears in the object editor  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:51): Okay, because the class is defined in the xml with the english version.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:53): Hmm, I have XE running and I add an object of BlogClass with language set to French, the blog object is still in English.  
glerouge - (00:53): objects are stored in only one language  
glerouge - (00:54): if you want to internationalize an app you need an object for each language  
glerouge - (00:54): one to store the FR version, one to store the EN version etc  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:54): It seems though that the pretty names of class properties aren't changing either.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:55): Even though there are translation keys.  
sdumitriu - (00:56): Let me check  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:57): Anyway I wanted to set the prettyNames in the registration class to $msg.get('XWiki.Registration\_someName') and XWiki.Configurable would just evaluate the pretty name when displaying, does that sound okay?  
sdumitriu - (01:03): Might be bugs  
sdumitriu - (01:04): OK, we need to revisit the localization  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:06): How is it supposed to work? I don't see anywhere where it says 'XWiki.BlogClass\_Title' so I don't see how it could translate.  
sdumitriu - (01:07): It should be automatically, without msg.get  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:07): So the prettyName is left empty and it gets filled in depending on the name and language?  
sdumitriu - (01:08): No, it's not left empty  
sdumitriu - (01:08): For the blog actually I see some of the translations  
sdumitriu - (01:09): Blog général (regroupe tous les articles publiés sur ce wiki)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:11): I see it too. It seems static list options are translated but not pretty names.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:13): Does (or should) getPrettyName() return the translated version?  
sdumitriu - (01:13): I don't know if it does, but it should  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:14): 'should' meaning will when this issue is fixed.  
sdumitriu - (01:15): Yep  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:16): Okay, I'll go ahead and set up the registration page configuration the same and wait for the fix.  
sdumitriu - (01:16): +1  
sdumitriu - (01:17): You can create the issues for this, though  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:17): Sure.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:18): One more thing, I made 5 translation keys which are incorrectly named against naming conventions for Registration.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:19): released in 2.2 so I figure I should duplicate and deprecate them then remove them in 2.4, sound right?  
sdumitriu - (01:19): Yes  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:20): I am also going to make a point of asking about everything to do with l10n from now on, mistakes are too expensive!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (01:26): XWIKI-4923 Here's the issue.  
sdumitriu left at 01:29 (\*.net \*.split

plunden - (09:55): Hello. Has something changed with groovy lately? I mean http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyNotificationTutorial has groovy code without statement terminating semicolons. An overlook perhaps?  
tmortagne - (09:58): plunden: AFAIK that's not new, that's a core feature of groovy since a long time now  
plunden - (09:58): Ah, nevermind. They're optional, it seems. :-)  
tmortagne - (09:58): yes  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:21  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:24  
sdumitriu - (10:39): !news  
oxi joined #xwiki at 10:45  
bblfish - (11:50): hello  
lucaa - (11:51): hi bblfish  
bblfish - (11:51): I got a bit sidetracked over the last few days in a semantic discussion, which I think we will be able to solve very neatly now. But I still have to do a bit of research  
bblfish - (11:52): I was thinking perhaps in the meantime, I could deploy the cert creation service  
bblfish - (11:52): tomorrow I am going to be talking at a linked data meeting http://www.meetup.com/Web-Of-Data/calendar/12317420/  
bblfish - (11:52): and http://foaf.me/ is often down  
bblfish - (11:53): ( usually whenever I give a talk )

arkub left at 12:51 (Quit: Leaving  
jvelociter - (13:15): nice JS playground http://jsfiddle.net/zalun/FZqZN/  
anamarias - (13:19): hi  
anamarias - (13:19): How do I get the Syntax (as Syntax object) of a document (XWikiDocument) ?  
anamarias - (13:19): I see only getSyntaxId() as public, getSyntax() is private  
anamarias - (13:19): I guess I can build it from the sintaxId, but I don't know what the constructor parameters mean : public Syntax(SyntaxType type, String version)  
tmortagne - (13:23): anamarias: getSyntax() is oublic, in which version are you looking ?  
tmortagne - (13:23): public  
anamarias - (13:24): hmm  
tmortagne - (13:24): it's public on trunk  
tmortagne - (13:24): only on trunk i think  
anamarias - (13:25): Oops, I was looking at 2.0.2  
tmortagne - (13:25): anamarias: about creating Syntax object: you are supposed to use SyntaxFactory componenet  
anamarias - (13:25): in the current one it's public  
tmortagne - (13:25): (if you need to)  
anamarias - (13:25): ah cool, thanks  
anamarias - (13:26): well, I don't need it now, but good to know :P  
tmortagne - (13:26): sure  
bblfish left at 13:44 (Read error: Operation timed out  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 13:45  
vmassol - (13:45): good morning everyone  
vmassol - (13:45): is there someone who could take this bug for 2.2.1? http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4590  
vmassol - (13:46): tmortagne: are you busy or is that something you could take?  
tmortagne - (13:46): vmassol: first we need to agree on how to do that  
vmassol - (13:46): yes  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 13:47  
bblfish - (13:47): in the trunk version I am using (late last week) the User profile appears in a grey box class=UserInfo is very narrow  
bblfish - (13:48): just using firebug to understand why  
vmassol - (13:54): tmortagne: I've read again the thread and we're close to an agreement IMO  
tmortagne - (13:54): vmassol: yes we are but nobody answered to my last proposal  
vmassol - (13:54): I did  
tmortagne - (13:54): which was my first proposal too...  
vmassol - (13:55): if by last you mean reusing the ajax apram  
vmassol - (13:55): \*param  
tmortagne - (13:55): no  
tmortagne - (13:55): by last i mean my last mail  
vmassol - (13:55): oops I missed some mesages  
vmassol - (13:55): reading....  
vmassol - (13:59): tmortagne: replying now  
tmortagne - (14:03): vmassol: do you think fixing something on XWikiSyntax needs a jira issue ? (i mean the XWikiSyntax page on svn)  
vmassol - (14:03): normally yes unless it's very minor  
vmassol - (14:03): it's in XE or the admin app? (I don't recall)  
tmortagne - (14:03): XE  
vmassol - (14:04): ok so we can be sure it'll get released  
vmassol - (14:04): no need for an issue if it's not too big  
vmassol - (14:04): (IMO)  
tmortagne - (14:04): it's the html macro doc that it's saying wiki is true by default, not sure how big it is. It's is important for sure.  
tmortagne - (14:06): i guess it deserve an issue, even if it's not technical it's a big bug  
vmassol - (14:06): yes  
vmassol - (14:06): better have an issue  
vmassol - (14:06): so that users have more chance of seeing it  
tmortagne - (14:07): yes  
vmassol - (14:13): sdumitriu: do you think you could look at http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4869 ? I guess I could look too but since you know the PDF export much better, maybe it's best you have a look?  
sdumitriu - (14:13): Yes  
vmassol - (14:13): (this issue is needed by ludovic for XE 2.2.1)  
sdumitriu - (14:13): I already did  
vmassol - (14:13): cool  
vmassol - (14:18): tmortagne: can we count on you for http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4590 ?  
vmassol - (14:18): (ie you take the lead on it)  
tmortagne - (14:19): vmassol: sure i was already the one responsible for this, forgot to assign myself on it it seems  
vmassol - (14:20): ok thanks

bblfish - (15:52): is there some code that I can use as a guide on how to create a class in velocity?  
sdumitriu - (15:54): What kind of class?  
tmortagne - (15:59): bblfish: there is no such thing as velocity class but maybe you are talking about XWiki xclass in documents ?  
SvenDowideit left at 15:59 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
bblfish left at 16:00 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 16:01  
bblfish - (16:01): yes, I am writing something like this  
bblfish - (16:01):   #set($rsadoc = $xwiki.createDocument())  
bblfish - (16:01):   $rsadoc.setName("XWiki.foafssl\_RSAPubKey\_2")  
bblfish - (16:01):   #set ($clzz = $rsadoc.getXClass())  
bblfish - (16:01):   $clzz.addTextAreaField("hexModulus", "hexModulus", 60, 5)  
bblfish - (16:01):   $rsadoc.save()  
bblfish - (16:01): (did I miss something)  
tmortagne - (16:03): first thisn: you should do directly  
tmortagne - (16:03): #set($rsadoc = $xwiki.getDocument(""XWiki.foafssl\_RSAPubKey\_2""))  
tmortagne - (16:03): #set($rsadoc = $xwiki.getDocument("XWiki.foafssl\_RSAPubKey\_2"))  
bblfish - (16:04): ah ok  
tmortagne - (16:04): did not even know there was a $xwiki.createDocument  
tmortagne - (16:05): $xwiki.getDocument( always return a document, when it does not exist it give you an empty one you can then save  
vmassol - (16:06): lucaa: any change of having annotationsin XE 2.3 timeframe?  
vmassol - (16:07): (timeframe defined here: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap)  
lucaa - (16:08): sounds good  
vmassol - (16:08): s/change/chance/  
lucaa - (16:08): I should be able to commit something for the M2  
vmassol - (16:08): ok that would be good  
lucaa - (16:09): actually, I should commit them now in the platforms  
lucaa - (16:09): s/platforms/platform/  
lucaa - (16:09): actually, no not really...  
lucaa - (16:09): I still need to make the model work on 2.3...  
vmassol - (16:09): CalebJamesDeLisl: re invitation manager, do you think you'll have something in the XE 2.3M1 or 2.3M2 timeframe?  
vmassol - (16:09): (dates are on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap )  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:12): Depends on whether I rewrite it or just get the current one working.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:14): I think it would be nice as an application since it has to store information and I think it's ugly for the core to depend on things being in the database.  
florinciu left at 16:14 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter - (16:19): tmortagne: the redirect issue mentioned yday; I can't reproduce on standard distrib  
jvelociter - (16:19): but apparently it has been seen on most of our 2.1 and 2.2 installs  
jvelociter - (16:19): and most of the times, it's fixed by a tomcat restart  
tmortagne - (16:21): jvelociter: no idea what it could be  
tmortagne - (16:21): is it random on install you have the issue ?  
tmortagne - (16:22): are all these installs use a auto restart script check ?  
jvelociter - (16:22): tmortagne: at the moment neither do I. IT seems random except on 1 install where it is constant (a restart does not fix the issue)  
jvelociter - (16:22): yes  
jvelociter - (16:23): try this url : http://saas.devxwiki.com/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/ this is the one that always fails  
tmortagne - (16:23): what happen on the install that constantly have the issue if you disable the crontab  and restart?  
tmortagne - (16:23): is there any special configuration in it ?  
jvelociter - (16:34): tmortagne: let me try  
jvelociter - (16:34): tmortagne: no special conf, no  
SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 16:38  
jvelociter - (16:51): tmortagne: same without the crontab  
jvelociter - (16:51): so with init triggered by a request from the outside  
jvelociter - (16:51): still http://saas.devxwiki.com/xwikihttp://localhost/xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?srid=Y7gt4Ua1  
tmortagne - (16:52): well if it's a stanhdard XE without any specific configuration and you can't reproduce the issue on fresh distribution it really seems weird  
jvelociter - (16:52): tmortagne: ah wait  
tmortagne - (16:52): can't it be a wonrg apache configuration ?  
jvelociter - (16:52): there is an xmlrpc request on localhost just after the startup  
jvelociter - (16:52): hmm wonder where it comes from  
jvelociter - (16:52): let me check  
tmortagne - (16:53): maybe xmlrpc does not initialize XWiki instance properly for some reson  
jvelociter - (16:54): but I don"r know where the xmlrpc request comes from  
jvelociter - (16:58): tmortagne: ok that makes sense  
glerouge - (17:02): jvelociter: livetable can't filter on a list item that has an accent in its name in IE6 -> is that a known problem ?  
jvelociter - (17:02): glerouge: no I don't think so  
jvelociter - (17:02): you've found anything in JIRA ?  
glerouge - (17:03): haven't looked yet (blush)  
glerouge - (17:04): I'll turn my strings into unaccentuated items  
vmassol - (17:04): glerouge/jvelociter: isn't that the encoding issue jerome fixed in 2.2?  
glerouge - (17:05): it works in FF but not in IE  
jvelociter - (17:05): vmassol: glerouge ah yes maybe  
glerouge - (17:05): too bad, I'm using a 2.1  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:07): vmassol: get my reply about the invitation manager?  
vmassol - (17:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes but I don't know how it's coded (never checked the existing code)  
vmassol - (17:08): so indeed we need to discuss the strategy we want to have on the list  
jvelociter - (17:08): tmortagne: ok, it's a xmlrpc initialization issue it seems.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:08): Good thinking, It's a plugin, I am not sure how it stores information. Have to look.  
jvelociter - (17:09): it's probably not a new issue, but since now we are using the xmlrpc API to monitor some infos, we started to notice  
tmortagne - (17:09): jvelociter: probably  
jvelociter - (17:09): I will create a JIRA issue  
lucaa - (17:12): [myxwiki] restarting  
silviar left at 17:20 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter - (17:23): created XWIKI-4925  
jvelociter - (17:34): seems like i18n feature is broken  
jvelociter - (17:35): when I configure my wiki multilingual and precise "en, fr" as languages, I only see the "en" link in the header  
sdumitriu - (17:35): That's normal  
sdumitriu - (17:36): You only get links for existing translations  
jvelociter - (17:36): is it ?  
jvelociter - (17:36): ah ok  
sdumitriu - (17:36): Well, "normal"  
jvelociter - (17:36): so  
sdumitriu - (17:36): It's the way it's always been  
jvelociter - (17:36): where do you choose UI language?  
vmassol - (17:36): you don't!  
vmassol - (17:36): :)  
vmassol - (17:36): it's all in one  
jvelociter - (17:36): I thought we could in the past  
vmassol - (17:37): it's UI + page  
jvelociter - (17:37): right  
jvelociter - (17:37): it's bad  
vmassol - (17:37): we alreayd have a jira issue for this  
jvelociter - (17:37): yes  
jvelociter - (17:37): ok my mistake I thought we alwaus displayed links for the UI  
jvelociter - (17:37): it's not something very to fix I guess  
vmassol - (17:39): you can force the language though  
vmassol - (17:39): using &language in the url  
vmassol - (17:39): not sure if you can force it at the XWikiUsers level  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:51): I need to add a help page to explain the configuration for XWiki.Registration does XWiki.Registration\_help or XWiki.RegistrationHelp sound good?  
jvelociter - (17:59): RegistrationHelp is ok  
jvelociter - (17:59): XWiki.Registration\_help is not  
jvelociter - (17:59): the standard is camel case  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:07): Thanks, will do.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:07): Vincent re translations, thanks for telling me. I bookmarked the page in l10n and will set them when they show up.  
vmassol - (18:07): you force refresh them too  
vmassol - (18:08): otherwise it's done once per day I think  
vmassol - (18:08): s/you force/you can force/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:09): Can you tell me where the button is?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:10): If you know off the top of your head, otherwise don't bother looking.  
vmassol - (18:11): CalebJamesDeLisl: on this page: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/  
vmassol - (18:11): there's a "Reload Application XE"  
vmassol - (18:11): you might need to have proper rights to see it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:12): Okay thanks, I'll try it.  
tmortagne - (18:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/ is for all the XE files, you should go to http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XWikiCoreResources for ApplicationResource file  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:17): That was where I was going to edit but I already hit the reload button.  
tmortagne - (18:18): note that reload is take a lot of time  
jvelociter - (18:31): guys sdumitriu glerouge didn't we use to have a "language" field in XWiki.XWikiPreferences ? to allow to translate the confirmation email content for example ?  
jvelociter - (18:32): what's the current strategy for this ?  
jvelociter - (18:32): localization tool ?  
sdumitriu - (18:33): We used to  
bblfish - (18:34): should I try to add properties from velocity to a class - and create a class from there too?  
jvelociter - (18:34): sdumitriu: we just dropped it ?  
vmassol - (18:36): bblfish: not sure what you want to do. Basically you can either create that class in a page and have user import that page and thus that class or create it from java code triggered at init time for ex  
vmassol - (18:36): (if you want to always have that class in the wiki with no app to install)  
bblfish - (18:36): ah ok, I though I should create the class in Velocity  
vmassol - (18:36): not sure what doing it from velocity would gain  
vmassol - (18:36): unless the class creation has to be dynamic based on something  
bblfish - (18:37): no not really. So I just save the class and that's it  I suppse....  
vmassol - (18:37): velocity means the code would be packaged as a XAR anyway  
vmassol - (18:37): so you might as well package the class as a page too  
bblfish - (18:37): ok

lucaa left at 19:02 (Quit: Leaving.  
bblfish - (19:02): in the xar there are 2 files always, one of them a package.xml  
bblfish - (19:02): is that one important?  
vmassol - (19:02): yes  
vmassol - (19:03): but it's genertaed automatically by the maven xar plugin (if you're using it to generate the XAR)  
bblfish - (19:03): ah ok  
bblfish - (19:03): so all I need to put in git is the other file  
vmassol - (19:03): yes  
vmassol - (19:03): you can check ex of apps here:  
vmassol - (19:03): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
vmassol - (19:03): for ex: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/blog/  
bblfish - (19:04): btw, I'd suggest removing the content from these xml files and puting a relative link to an external file, so that one can see the real content of velocity, not munged  
bblfish - (19:05): then one can use editors that parse xml, html, and velocity  
bblfish - (19:05): to check the content  
vmassol - (19:13): interesting idea but it makes it not self contained and harder to manipulate in memory  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:16  
bblfish left at 19:27 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 19:27  
bblfish - (19:28): you could just add it to the build script to put them together  
bblfish - (19:28): no?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:31): I like the idea too since I'm constantly editing the xml files, sometimes breaking the build. Trouble is, what about pages with classes and objects?  
vmassol - (19:31): bblfish: ah you mean just modifying the XAR plugin and not the actual xml format  
bblfish - (19:32): well, that would be the first step, least painful  
vmassol - (19:32): only issue is when we export XARs from the wiki  
vmassol - (19:32): we'd have to manually modify them  
vmassol - (19:32): to extract the content
